3d_anim.name: 3d_anim
3d_anim.description: Use to animate 3D objects in a scene.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object. Use this name to animate a 3D object. To animate the camera,set the name to “camera”.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Set the coordinates to place the 3D object when the animation ends. The xyz coordinates are set as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the rotation of the 3D object when the animation ends. Enter rotation of the axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Sets the scale of the 3D object when the animation ends. Enter the scales for the axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Sets the duration of the animation in milliseconds. The default is 1,000.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Sets whether to wait for the animation to complete before proceeding. Takes true or false. The default value is true.

parameters.name: lookat
parameters.description: Used only when animating the camera. Point the camera in a specific direction by specifying the name or pos coordinates of the object.

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: Sets the effect to apply to the transformation. The following effects are available: jswing | def | easeInQuad | easeOutQuad | easeInOutQuad | easeInCubic | easeOutCubic | easeInOutCubic | easeInQuart | easeOutQuart | easeInOutQuart | easeInQuint | easeOutQuint | easeInOutQuint |

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: easeInSine | easeOutSine | easeInOutSine | easeInExpo | easeOutExpo | aseInOutExpo | easeInCirc | easeOutCirc easeInOutCirc | easeInElastic | easeOutElastic | easeInOutElastic | easeInBack ｜ easeOutBack ｜ easeInOutBack ｜ easeInBounce ｜ easeOutBounce ｜ easeInOutBounce

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_anim.sample:
[3d_model_new name = "mymodel" storage = "mymodel / scene.gltf"]
[3d_anim name = "miruku" pos = "79, -458,727" scale = "318.45,318.45,318.45" rot = "0.13,
-0.64,0" effect = "easeInCubic" wait = true]

3d_anim_stop.name: 3d_anim_stop
3d_anim_stop.description: Use to stop the animation of a 3D object.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the target 3D object.

parameters.name: finish
parameters.description: animation ends. If true, the object will continue to move to the position set by the animation. The default value is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_box_new.name: 3d_box_new
3d_box_new.description: Defines a 3D model as a cube.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object. Used to display or hide the model.

parameters.name: texture
parameters.description: Applies a texture to the cube. Place the texture image under “others / 3d / texture”. If one texture is set, all faces will use the same image; different textures can be applied to each face by using 6 textures separated by commas.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Sets the color of the cube. Takes 0xRRGGBB format.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Sets the width of the cube. The default is 1.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Sets the height of the cube. The default is 1.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Sets the depth of the cube. The default is 1.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Sets the coordinates to position the cube. Takes xyz coordinates as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the rotation of the cube. Takes the rotation of the xyz axes as comma- separated values.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Sets the scale of the cube. Enter the scales for the axes as comma- separated values.

parameters.name: tonemap
parameters.description: Sets whether tone mapping is applied to this object or not (tone mapping must be enabled for the scene.) The default value is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_box_new.sample:
; Define and display a cube
[3d_box_new name = "mybox1"]
[3d_show name = "mybox1" pos = "365,145,0" rot = "0.92, -4.3,0" scale = "0.77,0.77,0.77"
time = 2000]
; Example of using a different texture image for each of the 6 sides
[3d_box_new name = "mybox2" width = 100 height = 100 depth = 100 texture = "dice / 1.png, dice / 2.png, dice / 3.png, dice / 4.png, dice / 5.png, dice / 6.png "]]
[3d_show name = "mybox2" time = 2000]

3d_camera.name: 3d_camera
3d_camera.description:
Sets the camera for a 3D scene.
Note: To check the coordinates of the camera, we recommend using [camera_debug], which allows testing of the coordinates and tilt.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Sets the camera coordinates. Enter the xyz coordinates as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the tilt of the camera. Set the rotation of the xyz axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: tonemap
parameters.description: Sets tone mapping for the scene. Available types are: No / Linear / Reinhard / Uncharted2 / Cineon / ACES Filmic. The default is No (no tone mapping).

parameters.name: lookat
parameters.description: The name of the target 3D object in the scene that the camera will point to. Alternatively, you can point the camera at that coordinate by setting the pos tag.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_canvas_hide.name: 3d_canvas_hide
3d_canvas_hide.description:
Hides, but does not delete the 3D canvas.
This is useful, for example, if the game frequently switches between a 3D scene and visual novel gameplay.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time in milliseconds over which the 3D canvas will disappear. The default is 1000.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_canvas_show.name: 3d_canvas_show
3d_canvas_show.description:
Hides, but does not delete the 3D canvas.
This is useful, for example, if the game frequently switches between a 3D scene and visual novel gameplay.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time in milliseconds over which the 3D canvas will disappear. The default is 1000.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_debug.name: 3d_debug
3d_debug.description:
Adjust an object in the 3D scene by dragging and dropping them with the mouse.
To end debugging, click the button at the top left of the screen.

Mouse operations:
Left click: Camera orientation (rot)
Right click: Camera position (pos)
Center click: Z-axis of the position
Scroll: Scale

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object to be debugged.

parameters.name: button_text
parameters.description: Use to customize the text of the button that ends debugging. The default is “Close Camera Inspector”.

parameters.name: menu
parameters.description: Toggles the debug menu. If false is specified, only the button to end debugging will be visible. Default is true (sets the debug menu to visible).

parameters.name: overlap
parameters.description: Takes true or false as a parameter. When set to true, the model will be displayed in the foreground. Set this to true for the model to appear in front of the menu. The default is false.

parameters.name: reset
parameters.description: Takes true or false as a parameter. When set to true, the model will return to the position it was in before debugging once debugging ends. The default is false.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_debug.sample:
[3d_model_new name = "Robot" storage = "Robot.glb"]
[3d_show name = "Robot" rot = "0.28,0.67,0" pos = "-129, -24,910" scale = "9.68"]
Now let's Change the motion. [p]
[3d_debug name = "Robot"]

3d_debug_camera.name: 3d_debug_camera
3d_debug_camera.description:
Adjust the camera coordinates in a 3D scene by dragging and dropping with the mouse.
To end debugging, click the button at the top left of the screen.

Mouse operations:
Left click: Camera orientation (rot)
Right click: Camera position (pos)
Center click: Z-axis of the position

parameters.name: button_text
parameters.description: Customizes the text of the button that ends debugging. The default text is “Close Camera Inspector”.

parameters.name: menu
parameters.description: Toggles the debug menu. If false is specified, only the button to end debugging will be visible. Default is true (sets the debug menu to visible).

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_delete.name: 3d_delete
3d_delete.description:
Delete a 3D object.
This tag also deletes the object definition.
To use the object again, it must be re-registered using a *_new tag.
Frequently deleting 3D objects that are no longer in use will improve the performance of the game.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object to be deleted.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_delete.sample:
; Show a 3D image
[3d_image_new name = "myimg" texture = "room.jpg" width = 200 doubleside = true]
[3d_show name = "myimg"]

; Hide it. [p]
[3d_hide name = "myimg"]

; Delete the object and remove its definition [p]
[3d_delete name = "myimg"]

3d_delete_all.name: 3d_delete_all
3d_delete_all.description:
Delete all 3D objects and their definitions.
This tag is used when resetting a 3D scene.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_event.name: 3d_event
3d_event.description:
Used to trigger an event when an object in a 3D scene is clicked.
The event will not trigger unless an [s] tag has run.
Once the event triggers, events are automatically disabled (the event definition itself will remain).
To generate the event again, an [3d_event_start] tag must be used first.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object. Used to display or hide the model.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Sets the name of the scenario file to use. If omitted, the current scenario file will be used.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Sets the label name of the jump destination. If omitted, it will be executed from the beginning.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_event.sample:
; Define and display a 3D model
[3d_model_new name = "miruku" storage = "miruku / scene.gltf" scale = 300 pos = "0, -300,500"]
[3d_event name = "miruku" target = "miruku"]

; Show a 3D box
[3d_box_new name = "box" width = 100 height = 100 depth = 100 scale = 2 tone = false color = "0xFFFFFF"]
[3d_show name = "box" time = 2000]

; Event definition
[3d_event name = "miruku" target = "miruku_click"]
[3d_event name = "box" target = "box_click"]

[s]
* miruku_click
3D model clicked [p]

@jump target = "common"
* box_click
Box clicked [p]

* common
Resume the event [p]
@ 3d_event_start

3d_event_delete.name: 3d_event_delete

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the target 3D object. This is the name of the 3D object for which the event will be deleted.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_event_delete.sample:
; Show a 3D box
[3d_box_new name = "box" width = 100 height = 100 depth = 100 scale = 2 tone = false color = "0xFFFFFF"]
[3d_show name = "box" time = 2000]

; Delete the event definition. This will make it unresponsive when clicked.
[3d_event_delete name = "box"]

[s]

3d_event_start.name: 3d_event_start
3d_event_start.description:
Starts a registered 3D event.
All events will be disabled once an event has triggered; this tag is used to enable them again.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_event_stop.name: 3d_event_stop
3d_event_stop.description:
Stops a registered 3D event.
The registered event will not disappear after it is stopped and can restarted using the [3d_event_start] tag.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_gyro.name: 3d_gyro
3d_gyro.description:
Allows the player to control of the camera by tilting the smartphone.
For PC games, the gyro effect can be reproduced by the position of the mouse.

parameters.name: max_x
parameters.description: Sets the max X-axis tilt as an angle. The default is 30 degrees.

parameters.name: max_y
parameters.description: Sets the max the Y-axis tilt as an angle. The default is 30 degrees.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Sets the gyro mode to ‘position’ or ‘rotation’. The selected mode determines whether the camera is affected by rotation or a change in position with respect to tilt. The default is rotation.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_gyro_stop.name: 3d_gyro_stop
3d_gyro_stop.description:
Smartphone only.
Disables movement of the gyro.
To return the camera position, set the position using 3d_camera immediately after this tag.
To re-enable the gyro, use the [3d_gyro] tag.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_hide.name: 3d_hide
3d_hide.description:
Hide a 3D object on the game screen.
Executing this tag does not delete the definition of the 3D model.
Use the [3d_show] tag to show the model again.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object to be hidden.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time in milliseconds over which the object will disappear. The default is 500.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Sets whether to wait for object to completely disappear before proceeding. The default value is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_hide.sample:
; Show a 3D image
[3d_image_new name = "myimg" texture = "room.jpg" width = 200 doubleside = true]
[3d_show name = "myimg"]

; Hide the image [p]
[3d_hide name = "myimg"]

3d_hide_all.name: 3d_hide_all
3d_hide_all.description:
Hide all 3D objects on the game screen.
Executing this tag does not delete the definitions of the objects.
To display the objects again, use the [3d_show] tag.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time in milliseconds over which all 3D objects will disappear. The default is 500.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Sets whether to wait for objects to completely disappear before proceeding. The default value is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_image_new.name: 3d_image_new
3d_image_new.description:
Defines a 3D model of an image.
Images are added to 3D scenes as flat plates.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object. Used to display or hide the model.

parameters.name: texture
parameters.description: Applies a texture to the 3D object. Place the texture image under “others / 3d / texture”.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Sets the width of the 3D object. The default is 1.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Sets the height of the 3D object. If omitted, the aspect ratios of the imagewill be used to calculate the height.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Sets the depth of the 3D object. The default is 1.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Sets the coordinates to position the 3D object. Takes xyz coordinates as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the rotation of the 3D object. Takes the rotation of the xyz axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Sets the scale of the 3D object. Enter the scales for the axes as comma- separated values.

parameters.name: tonemap
parameters.description: Sets whether tone mapping is applied to this object or not (tone mapping must be enabled for the scene.) The default value is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_image_new.sample:
; Show an images as a 3D object
[3d_image_new name = "myimg" texture = "room.jpg" width = 200 doubleside = true]
[3d_show name = "myimg"]

3d_init.name: 3d_init
3d_init.description:
Running this tag adds a 3D scene to the game.
This tag must be run before other 3D tags (start with 3d_) can be used.
Run the tag just before using 3D features.
Run the [3d_close] tag once 3D functionality is no longer in use.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: Sets the layer on which the 3D model is placed.

parameters.name: camera
parameters.description: Sets the camera mode. “Perspective” (with perspective) “Orthographic” (parallel projection without perspective) The default is Perspective.

parameters.name: near
parameters.description: Sets how close to the camera to draw an object. The default is 1.

parameters.name: far
parameters.description: Sets how far from the camera to draw an object. High values can impact the performance of the game, so setting to the smallest possible value is recommended. The default is 5000.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_model_new.name: 3d_model_new
3d_model_new.description:
Loads and defines a 3D model in an external file format.
The model will not be displayed in the game screen when this tag is run. Use the tag [3d_show] to display the model.
Place 3D model files in the data / others / 3d / model folder.

posNoSets the coordinates at which to place the 3D object. Takes the xyz coordinates as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object. Used to display or hide the model.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Sets the 3D file (gltf obj format) to be used. Place the file in the others / 3d / model folder.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the rotation of the 3D object. Takes the rotation of the xyz axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Sets the scale of the 3D object. Enter scales for the axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: tonemap
parameters.description: Sets whether tone mapping is applied to this object or not (tone mapping must be enabled for the scene.) The default value is true.

parameters.name: motion
parameters.description: Sets name of the motion if there is a motion in the file. If not specified, the first motion file will be applied automatically.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Sets the folder where 3D models are located.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_model_new.sample:
[3d_init layer = 0]
[3d_model_new name = "mymodel" storage = "mymodel / scene.gltf"]
[3d_show name = "mymodel" pos = "100,20,20" rot = "1,1,1" scale = 10]

3d_motion.name: 3d_motion
3d_motion.summary: Adjust the motion of a 3D model
3d_motion.description:
Adjust the camera coordinates in a 3D scene by dragging and dropping with the mouse.
To end debugging, click the button at the top left of the screen.

Mouse operations:
Left click: Camera orientation (rot)
Right click: Camera position (pos)
Center click: Z-axis of the position

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the target 3D object.

parameters.name: motion
parameters.description: Sets the motion name.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_motion.sample:
; Define the model. Will first display a motion named ‘Running’.
[3d_model_new name = "Robot" storage = "Robot.glb" pos = "0,0,0" scale = "2" motion =
"Running"]
[3d_show name = "Robot" rot = "0.28,0.67,0" pos = "-129, -24,910" scale = "9.68"]

Now let's change the motion. [p]

[3d_motion name = "Robot" motion = "Punch"]

3d_scene.name: 3d_scene
3d_scene.description:
Open a specified website in the browser.
Note: an ‘await click’ must be placed immediately this tag.
Many environments restrict browsers from opening without user initiation.

parameters.name: tonemap
parameters.description: Sets tone mapping for the scene. Available parameters are: No / Linear Reinhard/ Uncharted2 / Cineon / ACES Filmic. The default is No (no tone mapping).

parameters.name: tonemap_value
parameters.description: Sets the strength of tone mapping. The default is 0.8.

parameters.name: light_amb
parameters.description: light_amb × Sets the intensity of ambient light. The default is 1, 0.5 is dark, 2 is bright, etc.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_show.name: 3d_show
3d_show.description: Display a registered 3D object on the game screen.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object to be displayed.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time in milliseconds over which the object will appear. The default is 500.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Sets whether to wait for object to completely display before proceeding. The default value is true.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Sets the coordinates to position the 3D object. Takes xyz coordinatesas comma-separated values.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the rotation of the 3D object. Takes the rotation of the xyz axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Sets the scale of the 3D object. Enter the scales for the axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_show.sample:
; Show an images as a 3D object
[3d_image_new name = "myimg" texture = "room.jpg" width = 200 doubleside = true]
[3d_show name = "myimg"]

3d_sphere_new.name: 3d_sphere_new
3d_sphere_new.description: Define a 3D model as a sphere.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object. Used to display or hide the model.

parameters.name: texture
parameters.description: Applies a texture to the sphere. Place the texture image under “others / 3d / texture”.We recommend using 256×256 or 512×512-sized textures.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Sets the color of the sphere. Takes 0xRRGGBB format.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Sets the coordinates to position the 3D object. Takes xyz coordinates as comma- separated values.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the rotation of the 3D object. Takes the rotation of the xyz axes as comma- separated values.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Sets the scale of the 3D object. Enter the scales for the axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Sets the radius of the sphere. The default is 300.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Sets the width of the sphere. The default is 30.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Sets the height of the sphere. The default is 30.

parameters.name: tonemap
parameters.description: Sets whether tone mapping is applied to this object or not (tone mapping must be enabled for the scene.) The default value is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

3d_sphere_new.sample:
[3d_sphere_new name = "tama"]
[3d_show name = tama pos = "365,145,0" rot = "0.92, -4.3,0" scale = "0.77,0.77,0.77" time = 2000]

3d_sprite_new.name: 3d_sprite_new
3d_sprite_new.description:
Defines a 3D model as a sprite.
The difference between this and a 3D image is that a sprite object always faces the camera.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the 3D object. Used to display or hide the model.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Sets the image file to be displayed. Place the file under the “others / 3d / sprite” folder.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Sets the coordinates to position the 3D object. Takes xyz coordinates as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: rot
parameters.description: Sets the rotation of the 3D object. Takes the rotation of the xyz axes as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Sets the scale of the 3D object. Enter the scales for the axes as comma- separated values.

parameters.name: tonemap
parameters.description: Sets whether tone mapping is applied to this object or not (tone mapping must be enabled for the scene.) The default value is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

anim.name: anim
anim.description:
With this you can animate a picture, button or even the contents of a layer.
You should call the element that you want to animate by using the name you gave it when it was created with the [ptext] or [ button ] tags.
When you set a layer, the animation will affect all elements in the layer.
This tag does not wait for the animation to stop. If you use the [wa] tag, you can wait for the completion of all animations that are being performed.
You can set the position of the animation using the values of -100 through 100. (From where it is currently, it can be moved to the left 100px)
If you set the opacity, you can also make something disappear.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: use this property to look up the button layer or picture to animate

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: if a name is set this will be ignored. Otherwise this to set the foreground layer

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: animate it horizontally to the position you set

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: animate it vertically to the position you set

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: set the width

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: set the height

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: set the value from 0-255. It will animate to the given opacity.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: set the color

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: time taken by the animation. Default is 2000 milliseconds

parameters.name: define the effect of the animation. examples are defined as follows
parameters.description: |easeOutCubic |easeInOutCubic |easeInQuart |easeOutQuart |easeInOutQuart |easeInQuint |

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: |easeOutQuint |easeInOutQuint |easeInSine |easeOutSine |easeInOutSine |easeInExpo |easeOutExpo |easeInOutExpo |easeInCirc |easeOutCirc |easeInOutCirc |easeInElastic |easeOutElastic |easeInOutElastic |easeInBack |easeOutBack |easeInOutBack |easeInBounce |easeOutBounce |easeInOutBounce

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

anim.sample:
[ptext layer=1 page=fore text="example text" size=30 x=0 y=0 color=red vertical=true]

[image layer=0 left=100 top=100 storage = yuko1.png page=fore visible=true name=yuko,chara ]
[image layer=1 left=300 top=100 storage = haruko1.png page=fore visible=true name=haruko ]

;set the name attribute animate
[anim name="haruko" left="=100" time=10000 effect=easeInCirc opacity=0 ]

;set the layer and animate
[anim layer=1 left="=100" effect=easeInCirc opacity=0 ]

;pause all animations
[wa]

Animations over

apply_local_patch.name: apply_local_patch
apply_local_patch.description:
Available from TyranoScript v470 and later.
Only used when packaging and distributing.
When this tag is reached, the user can apply a patch to the game.
When updating any folder other than the /data folder, apply the update at startup rather than using this tag.
The game may temporarily stop if the patch file is large. In these cases, it is best to notify the user via a loading notification, etc.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Specify the path of the patch file, starting from the folder that contains the .exe file.

parameters.name: reload
parameters.description: Set to true or false. If true, the game will be reloaded after applying the patch. The default is false.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Sets the speed of the auto mode in milliseconds.

parameters.name: Clickstop
parameters.description: Sets whether to cancel auto mode when the screen is clicked. Can be true (Stop when screen is clicked. Default mode.) or false (Do not stop.)

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

autoload.name: autoload
autoload.description: Loads data saved with the [autosave] tag.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

autosave.name: autosave
autosave.description: When this tag is reached, the play state will automatically be saved. Use this for games with an autosave system. If autosaved data exists, sf.system.autosave will be set to true. By using control logic like in the sample below, you can restore the player’s game state before the title screen is reached, which is useful on smartphones.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Sets the title of the saved data.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

autosave.sample:
[autosave]

;if autosaved data exists, sf.system.autosave will be set to true.
[if exp="sf.system.autosave ==true"]
You have autosaved data. Would you like to load it?[l][r]

[link target=*select1][1]Yes[endlink][r]
[link target=*select2][2]No[endlink][r]

[s]

*select1
;Execute load
[autoload]
*select2
[cm]
Load canceled.[l]
@jump target=*noload
[else]
There is no automatically saved data.[l][r]
[endif]

autostart.name: autostart
autostart.description:
Automatically advances the text display at a set rate.
Use the autoSpeed option in config.tjs to change the rate.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

awakegame.name: awakegame
awakegame.summary: Restore a Game From Paused State
awakegame.description: Restores a game that has been paused with the [gamesleep] tag. Any variables (f) that were changed while the game was asleep will be reflected after the game is restored. Processing will pass through the make.ks file before returning to the game. If you want to change any variables (f) before returning to the game, you can insert logic into the make.ks file to determine if [awakegame] is being used.

parameters.name: variable_over
parameters.description: Set to true or false. If this is set to true, game variables changed during sleepgame will be carried over once play is resumed. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: bgm_over
parameters.description: Set to true or false. If set to true, BGM played during sleepgame will continue to play. Defaults to true. If set to false, the BGM that was used when sleepgame was executed will play once more.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

backlay.name: backlay
backlay.summary: Copy Information from the Surface Page
backlay.description:
The layer that you designate or all of the layer information is copied from the front page to the back page.
The image of the front page layer marked with the [trans] tag moves to the back page’s image layer.
In order to do that, before the transition, the image is moved to the back with the [backlay] tag. On the back page, after the layer is manipulated, the transition is performed.

parameters.name: set the layer target
parameters.description: if set as an integer above zero then it becomes the foreground if you set as message0 or message1 then it will become that message layer. layer No if you set is as message it will become the message layer of whatever the [current] tag is set to. Even if the message layer is the back page it will copy that message layer from the front to the back. if this is omitted the information of every layer is copied to the back page

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

backlay.sample:
;The background change is executed via a transition
@layopt layer=message0 visible=false
[backlay]
[image layer=base page=back storage=rouka.jpg]
[trans time=2000]
[wt]

bg.name: bg
bg.description:
An easy way to change the background image.
Changes are always done to the fore layer.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Specifies the new image file. Please put the file in bgimage.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Specifies the method used to swap in the new background image. Default is “crossfade”. Available options are “crossfade”, “explode”, “slide”, “blind”, “bounce”, “clip”, “drop”, “fold”, “puff”, “scale”, “shake”, and “size”.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Specifies the time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Specifies whether or not to stop processing until the swap is complete.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

bgcamera.name: bgcamera
bgcamera.summary: Stream camera output to the background
bgcamera.description:
Use the output of the device camera as the background.
Can be used to easily create an app that takes a commemorative photo with your character.
Browser games must be deployed in a location accessible via https for this tag to work.

★ Note on QR codes
For the game to identify a QR code, the [s] tag must be reached or it will not respond.
Create a QR code as follows:

Set the storage and target of the jump tag as below and a QR code generating site.
tyrano: //storage=scene1.ks&target=test2

Alternatively, you can issue a QR code as-is using the below tag:
[jump storage = “scene1.ks” target = “test2”]

Then print the QR code and scan with the camera for it to be processed.

Also, once a QR code has been identified, it will no longer be active.
To reactivate a QR code, use the following tag at the jump destination:

[qr_config qrcode = “all”]

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Use in conjunction with an anim tag to start an animation, etc. Specify a name in advance for use in JS as a class attribute. You can specify more than one name by separating them with commas.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Set to true to display the camera input. The default value is true.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Specifies the fade-in time in milliseconds over which the camera input area will be displayed. The default is 1,000.

parameters.name: fit
parameters.description: Set to true to place the image over full screen even if the ratio is distorted. Set to false to place the image while maintaining the ratio it. Depending on the resolution of the camera, black bars may appear. The default value is true.

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: Sets the position in pixels from the left of the screen to place the camera image.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Sets the position in pixels from the top of the screen to place the camera image.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Sets the width of the camera image. (pixel)

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Sets the height of the camera image. (pixel)

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Set to “front” (front camera) or “back” (rear camera). If nothing is specified, a standard camera will be selected.

parameters.name: qrcode
parameters.description: Sets the operation to trigger when the QR code is read. “Jump” (for QR codes that trigger only in-game transitions), “web” (for links to other sites), “define” (for operations defined using qr_define), “all” (for all), “off” (does not respond to QR codes). The default is “off”.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.description: Sets whether to display the URL when a QR code is read. The default is false. Set to true to display the URL as an alert.

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: Sets whether to process audio input. Set to true to use audio input in the game. Default is false.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

bgcamera.sample:
; Display camera input in the background
[bgcamera time = 2000]

; Return the background to normal
[stop_bgcamera]

; Set coordinates at which to display camera input
[bgcamera width = 300 height = 200 left = 100 top = 100]

; When reacting to a QR code. Specify rear camera
[bgcamera mode = "back" fit = true qrcode = "all"]

bgmopt.name: bgmopt
bgmopt.description:
Changes the background music options.
Note that when the user is playing from a smartphone browser, the smartphone itself will not allow you to change the volume.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: Sets the volume of the BGM (0-100)

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: Set to true or false. (Defaults to true.) If true the change to the BGM will take place for the song current playing.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

bgmovie.name: bgmovie
bgmovie.description:
Supports ogv, webm, and mp4 formats.
The format used will differ depending on the game. Please use webm for PC games. mp4 is not supported. For a browser game, use mp4. But to allow for compatibility across all browsers including FireFox and Opera, please include a webm file of the same name.
Use the stop_bgmovie tag to stop the movie.
By playing a bgmovie when another bgmovie is looping, you can move to the next movie when the current one has finished its loop.
(Important Note) This tag is PC only. It does not work on smartphones.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Specifies the ogv, webm, or mp4 file that you want to play.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Used to set the time for a fade out effect when using a movie backdrop. Defaults t to 1,000 milliseconds.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: Sets the volume of the video. Please set to a value between 0 and 100. Default is 100.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: Sets whether or not to loop the background video. By setting false, it will pause in its final state.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

breakgame.name: breakgame
breakgame.description: This deletes the data saved when the [gamesleep] tag was used. If you’re not using [gameawake] to restore the state, please use this tag to delete the data.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

button.name: button
button.description:
This displays a graphical button.
This is a graphical version of the link tag. However, when a graphical button is displayed, the scenario is forced to come to a halt, so please be sure to specify a jump location.
Also, the graphical button’s display position will use the coordinates referred to by the locate tag directly in front of it. However, if an x and y value are specified, they will be given precedence. Note that movements from this button will not be stored in the call stack, which means that it is impossible to return from them.
Note: If you set fix to true, the location will be stored in the call stack. Note that if you do this, buttons will be disabled until you return from the call.
After jumping, make sure to use the [cm] tag to hide the button.

parameters.name: graphic
parameters.description: Specifies the graphic for the button image. Please put the file in the image folder.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Specifies the scenario file to jump to. If this is omitted, the current scenario file will be used.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Specifies the label to jump to. If this is omitted, the file will be executed from the first line.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Tyranoscript Only. You can use the anim tag to create an animation using this name. By specifying a name, you can also control it from JavaScript as a class attribute. It’s possible to specify multiple names by separating them with a comma.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the button.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Specifies the vertical position of the button.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Specifies the width of the button in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Specifies the height of the button in pixels.

parameters.name: fix
parameters.description: Set to true or false. Defaults to false. If true, is set, the button will be displayed on the fix layer. This allows the scenario to proceed even while the button is displayed. For example, you can use this to display buttons that should remain onscreen at all times, such as a save button. Also, to clear out any additions to the fix layer, you can use the clearfix tag. When setting fix to true, make sure you specify a target in a different storage, and put the processing logic for the button there. When fix is set to true, the current location will remain in the call stack. Note that no buttons will be usable until the location is removed from the call stack.

parameters.name: savesnap
parameters.description: Set to true or false. Defaults to false. A save snapshot is created when this button is pressed. When moving to the save screen, set this to true to allow for saving.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Allows you to pick an image from any folder you like. Normally the foreground layer is fgimage and the background layer is bgimage, but you can select anything from the folder you specify here.

parameters.name: exp
parameters.description: Allows you to specify JavaScript to be executed when the button is clicked.

parameters.name: preexp
parameters.description: A value can be placed in the variable preexp when the tag is evaluated. In other w words, when the button is clicked, you can use the variable preexp in the exp JavaScript.

parameters.name: hint
parameters.description: Specifies tool tip text that will appear when the mouse cursor hovers over the button.

parameters.name: clickse
parameters.description: Specifies the sound effect to play when the button is clicked. Please put the file in the sound folder.

parameters.name: enterse
parameters.description: Specifies the sound effect that plays when the mouse cursor enters the button region. Please put the file in the sound folder.

parameters.name: leavese
parameters.description: Specifies the sound effect that plays when the mouse cursor leaves the button region. Please put the file in the sound folder.

parameters.name: clickimg
parameters.description: Specifies the image file that will be swapped in when the button is clicked. Please put the file in the image folder.

parameters.name: enterimg
parameters.description: Specifies the image file that will be swapped in when the mouse cursor enters the button region. Please put the file in the image folder.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Determines whether the button is visible by default. True is visible and false is invisible.

parameters.name: auto_next
parameters.description: Specify true or false. If false is specified, when the fix parameter is use, the game will not automatically proceed to the next tag after the [return] tag.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Assigns a special function to the button. If this parameter is used, the storage and target parameters will be ignored. The fix parameter will automatically be set to true. Available options are save (displays the save screen), load (displays the load screen), title (returns to the title screen), menu (returns to the menu screen), window (hides the message window), skip (executes a skip), backlog (displays the backlog), fullscreen (switches fullscreen mode), quicksave (executes a quicksave), quickload (executes a quickload), and sleepgame (Saves game state and jumps).

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

button.sample:
[locate x=20 y=100]
[button graphic="oda.png" target=*oda]

[locate x=300 y=100]
[button graphic="toyo.png" target=*toyo]

call.name: call
call.description:
Call a subroutine by label and scenario file.
if a subroutine contains a [return] tag, execution will pick up after where the subroutine was called

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Set the scenario file containing the subroutine you wish to call. If parameter is missing the current scenario file is used.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The label of the subroutine you wish to call. The first label found in the file is used.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

camera.name: camera
camera.description:
You can add instructions to zoom or pan the camera. Using this functionality you can focus on a character’s expression, or carry out a number of impressive effects using a single still image.

To use the camera function, you must set the useCamera tag to true in config.tjs.
Also, when using the camera function, screen centering will be disabled.

Camera coordinates are defined relative to the center of the screen, which is (x:0,y:0). For example, the upper right of the screen is x:200, y:200, and the lower left is x:-200, y:-200.
To return the camera to its original position, use the [reset_camera] tag. To wait for the camera effect to complete, use the [wait_camera] tag.

*IMPORTANT*
When your camera effect is finished, please ensure you use the [reset_camera] tag to return the camera to its original position. If you do not do this, you will be unable to use the background change tag [bg], or other tags.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

cancelskip.name: cancelskip
cancelskip.description:
Cancel option to skip through dialog.
Able to override player initiated skips.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

parameters.name: pos_mode
parameters.description: set as true or false. default is true. when true the [chara_show] tag (etc) will automatically place the character

parameters.name: ptext
parameters.description: set the name text to show when the character is speaking. for example when defined like this [ptext name

parameters.name: The way that a character moves in or out.jswing |def |easeInQuad |easeOutQuad
parameters.description: |easeOutQuart

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: |easeInOutQuart |easeInQuint |easeOutQuint |easeInOutQuint |easeInSine |easeOutSine |easeInOutSine |easeInExpo |easeOutExpo |easeInOutExpo |easeInCirc |easeOutCirc |easeInOutCirc |easeInElastic |easeOutElastic |easeInOutElastic |easeInBack |easeOutBack |easeInOutBack |easeInBounce |easeOutBounce |easeInOutBounce

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_delete.name: chara_delete
chara_delete.description:
Delete character and character info.
If you want to just remove the character from the screen, use [chara_hide] instead.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name set by [chara_new]

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_face.name: chara_face
chara_face.description: Allows you to register a name and image for a character facial expression

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Please specify the name defined by the [chara_new] tag.

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: Specify the name of the character’s facial expression.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Specify the image file for the expression. Put the image in the fgimage folder.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_face.sample:
;Register Expression
[chara_face name="yuko" face="angry" storage="newface.png"]
;Apply Expression
[chara_mod name="yuko" face="angry"]
;When you want to change the speaker's name as well.
[chara_ptext name="yuko" face="angry"]
;These can be shortened, as per below.
#yuko:angry
;The image registered when chara_new was used can be accessed using the word default.
#yuko:default

chara_hide.name: chara_hide
chara_hide.description: hide a character that has been displayed with [chara_show]

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name defined by [chara_new]’s name attribute

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: if this is set to true the character will wait to disappear. Default is true

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: set in milliseconds. this is the length of time for a character to disappear. The default is 1000 milliseconds

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: remove the character from the layer set by [chara_show] if it is set. the default is 0

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: if set to true and the ptext of the name already exists on the screen you can change just the text. the default is false

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_hide_all.name: chara_hide_all
chara_hide_all.summary: Remove All Characters from the Screen
chara_hide_all.description: Removes all characters displayed with the [chara_show] tag from the screen.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: If set to true, the game processing will wait for the characters to disappear. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Sets the time in milliseconds. The characters will disappear from the screen in the specified amount of time. Defaults to 1,000 milliseconds.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: The layer to be deleted. Use this if you specified a layer when using the chara_show tag. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_mod.name: chara_mod
chara_mod.description: Change the sprite of a character on the screen. Likely useful for changing facial expressions.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: set the name defined with [chara_new]

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: set the face defined with [chara_face]

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: specify the duration in milliseconds over which to crossfade expressions using the [chara_mod] tag. The default is 600 milliseconds. Set to 0 for the change to happen instantly

parameters.name: reflect
parameters.description: set to true to horizontally flip the image

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: new character sprite file. Should be located in the fgimage folder of the project

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: sets whether the project should wait for the expression change to complete before proceeding. Set to true or false. The default is true

parameters.name: cross
parameters.description: Set to true to crossfade 2 images. Set to false to fade a new expression onto an old expression. The default is true

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_move.name: chara_move
chara_move.summary: Change the Position of a Character
chara_move.description: Change the position of a character on the screen.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Use the name parameter set in [chara_new].

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Enter a number of milliseconds greater than 0, and movement will occur over the set duration. The default is 600 ms.

parameters.name: anim
parameters.description: Set to ‘true’ or ‘false’. The default is ‘false’. When set to ‘true’, the movement will be animated. The animation effect is set in the [chara_config] effect parameter.

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: Set the horizontal position of the destination point from the left of the screen.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Set the vertical position of the destination point from the top of the screen.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Set the width at the destination point.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Set the height at the destination point.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Set to ‘true’ or ‘false’ to set whether to wait for the movement to complete or not. The default is ‘true’.

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: Set the transition effect. The following effects are: jswing|def|easeInQuad|easeOutQuad|easeInOutQuad|easeInCubic|easeOutCubic|easeInOutCubic|easeInQuart|easeOutQuart|easeInOutQuart|easeInQuint|easeOutQuint|easeInOutQuint|easeInSine|easeOutSine|easeInOutSine|easeInExpo|easeOutExpo|easeInOutExpo|easeInCirc|easeOutCirc|easeInOutCirc|easeInElastic|easeOutElastic|easeInOutElastic|easeInBack|easeOutBack|easeInOutBack|easeInBounce|easeOutBounce|easeInOutBounce

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_new.name: chara_new
chara_new.description:
Set the info for a new character. after that, it can be further manipulated with the [chara_show] tag and others.
Also you can set the name here which is referenced by the [anim] tag later.
In other words, after you add a character, you can freely animate it.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name that this character will be referenced by (written in ASCII characters). This name must be unique.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: set the character picture. this should be in the project’s fgimage directory

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Set the width of the picture

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Set the height of the picture

parameters.name: jname
parameters.description: when this character’s name is shown this is the display version. For example when Yuko is used “???” can appear in the message area

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

chara_ptext.name: chara_ptext
chara_ptext.summary: Display Speaking Character’s Name or Change Expression
chara_ptext.description:
You can set the message box of a speaker defined using the format [chara_config ptext=”hogehoge”] to the name defined by the name parameter. And by using the face parameter, you can also change their expression.
This tag can be written in an abbreviated manner.

#chara_name:face_name and [ptext name=”chara_name” face=”face_name”] will behave in the same manner.
The image file registered when the [chara_new] tag was used can be referred to by face=”default”.
[chara_new name=”yuko” storage=”yuko.png” jname=”Yuko”]

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specifies the name defined by [chara_new]. The associated jname will be displayed in the ptext field.

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: Please specify the face defined by [chara_face]

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: reference the character to show with the name previously defined by [chara_new]

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Set the time it takes for the character to appear?The default is 1000 milliseconds

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: The layer to place the character in. The default is the foreground (layer

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: set fore or back. The default is fore.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: if true is set the character’s appearance will be delayed. The default is true

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: sets the horizontal position. If this is set automatic movement will not be affected

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: sets the vertical position. If this is set automatic movement will not be affected

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

check_web_patch.name: check_web_patch
check_web_patch.summary: Check and Apply an Update from a Server
check_web_patch.description:
Available from TyranoScript v470 and later.
Use this to automatically display a message and notify the user when a patch is available on a server.
Upload the json and patch files to the server.
The game must be restarted to complete applying the patch.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Specify the URL of json file on the server, starting with http://

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

clearfix.name: clearfix
clearfix.description: by setting the name property, only the corresponding element can be deleted

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name used when the fix layer was declared

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

clearfix.sample:
;add a fix Layer
[ptext name="sample" layer=fix page=fore text="TextText" size=30 x=200 y=100 color=red ]

;clear fix Layer
[clearfix name="sample"]

clearstack.name: clearstack
clearstack.description:
Clears the system-managed stack.
The stack is a memory area used to store the return locations for calls, macro functions, and if statements. In a normal novel game, this won’t cause any issues, but if the game makes repeated jump statements during an if or call area, the stack will begin to fill up with unused return locations. This can cause problems such as large save files, so when there’s nothing in the stack for the game to return to, we recommend using this tag.

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: You can specific “call”, “if”, or “macro” to only delete a certain stack. If nothing is specified then all stacks will be deleted.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

clickable.name: clickable
clickable.description:
Defines a clickable area.
Because showing clickable areas pause the execution of the scenario script, a jump target must be set. Also as with graphical button’s [locate] tag must be set for reference.
Keep in mind that this movement does not exist on the call stack so a return is not possible.
Important:if an [s]tag is reached, the clickable area will not be valid. Only use the [s] tag to stop the game.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: set width of area

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: set height of area

parameters.name: borderstyle
parameters.description: You can show a border of the area with a line. The style of the line looks like this: “thickness:style:color”. Possible line types are solid double groove dashed dotted etc

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: specify the box like this: 0xRRGGBB

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: this sets the opacity from 0-255. 0 is completely transparent.

parameters.name: mouseopacity
parameters.description: when the mouse is over the clickable area you can change the transparency. Values can range from 0-255. 0 is completely transparent

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: set the scenario file to jump to. If this is omitted the current file will be used.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: when the clickable area is clicked jump to that location. If omitted it will jump to the top.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

clickable.sample:
[locate x=20 y=100]
[clickable width=200 height=300 target=*oda]

[locate x=300 y=100]
[clickable width=100 height=100 border="solid:1px:gray" target=*oda]

parameters.name: ask
parameters.description: if true is set a confirmation will be requested. If false is set no confirmation will occur. This attribute is set to true by default.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

parameters.name: name

parameters.name: grayscale
parameters.description: Set a value from 0 (default) to 100 to change the image to grayscale.

parameters.name: sepia
parameters.description: Set a value from 0 (default) to 100 to apply a sepia effect.

parameters.name: saturate
parameters.description: Sets the initial x coordinate.

parameters.name: hue
parameters.description: Sets the initial y coordinate.

parameters.name: brightness
parameters.description: Sets whether to wait for the camera to finish moving. If this is set to false, the game can continue during the camera movement. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: contrast
parameters.description: Sets the layer. Use “base” for background and any positive number for the foreground layer. Allows you to set the camera effect to only take place on a certain layer.

parameters.name: blur
parameters.description: Sets the camera effect type. Options are ease (Move smoothly between the start and finish times), linear (Move at a constant speed) ease-in (Move slowly at first), ease-out (Move slowly at the end) and ease-in-out (Move slowly at the start and end.) The default is ease.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

glink.name: glink
glink.description:
Displays a graphical button. No image file is needed. When a graphical link is being displayed, the scenario is forced to come to a halt, so please be sure to specify a jump location.
Also, the graphical button’s display position will use the coordinates referred to by the locate tag directly in front of it. However, if an x and y value are specified, they will be given precedence. Note that movements from this button will not be stored in the call stack, which means that it is impossible to return from them.
After the jump, the [cm] tag is automatically executed, and the button will disappear.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Specifies the color of the button. Defaults to black. (black gray white orange red blue rosy green pink)

parameters.name: font_color
parameters.description: Specifies the color of the font. Please specify in 0xRRGGBB format.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Specifies the scenario file to jump to. If this is omitted, the current scenario file will be used.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Specifies the label to jump to. If this is omitted, the file will be executed from the first line.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Tyranoscript Only. You can use the anim tag to create an animation using this name. By specifying a name, you can also control it from JavaScript as a class attribute. It’s possible to specify multiple names by separating them with a comma.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text of the button.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the button.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Specifies the vertical position of the button.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Specifies the height of the button in pixels.

parameters.name: exp
parameters.description: Allows you to specify JavaScript to be executed when the button is clicked.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Specifies the font size. Default is 30.

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: Specifies the font. If you wish to use a web font, please define it in font.css.

parameters.name: graphic
parameters.description: Specifies the background image of the button. Please put the file in the image folder. if an image is used, the color parameter will be ignored.

parameters.name: enterimg
parameters.description: Specifies the image file that will be swapped in when the mouse cursor enters the button region. Please put the file in the image folder.

parameters.name: clickse
parameters.description: Specifies the sound effect to play when the button is clicked. Please put the file in the sound folder.

parameters.name: enterse
parameters.description: Specifies the sound effect that plays when the mouse cursor enters the button region. Please put the file in the sound folder.

parameters.name: leavese
parameters.description: Specifies the sound effect that plays when the mouse cursor leaves the button region. Please put the file in the sound folder.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

glink.sample:
[glink target="j1" text="Choice #1" size=20 width="500" y=300]
[glink target="j2" text="Choice #2" size=30 width="500" y=400]
[glink target="j3" text="Choice #3" size=30 width="500" y=400]
[s]
