Show arbitrary images inside of a message.
You can use pictographs or special characters, etc.
Put images you want to show in the image folder.
Also, for frequently used symbols, it’s easy to set up a macro.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: The filename where the picture is stored

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

graph.sample:
; put a heart picture in
[macro name="heart"][graph storage="heart.png"][endmacro]

; below, with the [heart] tag, a heart symbol can be used
I love you![heart]

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

hidemessage.name: hidemessage
hidemessage.description:
temporarily hides the message layer. This will perform the same action as if you were to chose clear message from the menu.
after waiting for a click, the message layer is shown, and the script execution continues.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

html.name: html
html.description:
In between [html] and [endhtml] HTML can be entered.
This feature is very powerful. Of course JavaScript, Canvas, and next generation web expressions are supported.
For example a Youtube video player can be inserted and any number of public APIs can be accessed.
By using this tag, any HTML elements can be added.
If you use the [cm] tag and do not clear everything, even if you click the game cannot continue.
By all means use graphic buttons, etc. to ensue that you can jump to a game state where you can still continue.
Inside of this tag, variables of TyranoScript can be used.
[emb] tags inside of previously set HTML can be used.

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: sets the horizontal position of the [HTML] tag in pixels

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: sets the vertical position of the [HTML] tag in pixels

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: you can set the name of the HTML area. Using this name animations can be performed with the HTML.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

html.sample:
;place the youtube player in a designated spot
;use the embed tag for youtube
[html top=100 left=300]










[endhtml]

if.name: if
if.description: if the evaluation of the expression is true (or a non-zero number), the statements and tags up until elsif, else and endif tag are executed, otherwise those statements and tags are ignored and the statements and tags inside of elsif or else would be executed instead.

parameters.name: exp
parameters.description: a TJS expression to be evaluated. If the expression is false (or 0)- the statements and tags will be ignored until an elsif else or endif tag.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

if.sample:
; example 1 [if exp="false"]
This will not be displayed
[else]
This will be displayed
[endif]

; example 2 [if exp="false"]
This will not be displayed
[elsif exp="false"]
This will not be displayed
[else]
This will be displayed
[endif]

; example 3 [if exp="false"]
This will not be displayed
[elsif exp="true"]
This will be displayed
[else]
This will not be displayed
[endif]

; example 4 [if exp="true"]
This will be displayed
[elsif exp="true"]
This will not be displayed
[else]
This will not be displayed
[endif]

ignore.name: ignore
ignore.description: When the expression evaluates to true (or is a non-zero number) do not execute any tags or statements until after the [endignore] tag

parameters.name: exp
parameters.description: this is the expression (in TJS) that is evaluated.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

image.name: image
image.description: Displays an image on a layer. You can use this for displaying characters and changing backgrounds. The foreground layer is invisible by default, so set visible=true to display it.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Specifies the image file. If the image is going to background layer, please put it in bgimage, if it’s for the foreground layer put it in fgimage.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: Specifies the target layer. Set “base” for the background layer, and any positive number for the foreground layer.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies the target page. Please set this to “fore” or “back”. If this parameter is missing it will default to “fore”.

parameters.name: Left
parameters.description: Sets the left edge location of the image. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Sets the top edge location of the image. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Sets the left edge location of the image. Same as left. If both are specified this will be given priority. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Sets the top edge location of the image. Same as top. If both are specified this will be given priority. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Sets the width of the image. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Sets the height of the image. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Allows you to pick an image from any folder you like. Normally the foreground layer is fgimage and the background layer is bgimage, but you can select anything from the folder you specify here.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Tyranoscript Only. You can use the anim tag to create an animation using this name. By specifying a name, you can also control it from JavaScript as a class attribu te. It’s possible to specify multiple names by separating them with a comma.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: By setting the time in milliseconds, you can gradually display an image.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Automatically decides the layer position. Used for the foreground layer. The horizontal position can be either left, left_center, center, right_center, or right, as specified by this parameter. The exact coordinates for each position can be set in the config.tjs file. Instead of typing left, left_center, center, right_center, or right, you can use l, lc, c, rc, or r, respectively. (It works the same way.) If you use this parameter, the left and top parameters will be ignored. If you set the layer to base, please do not use this parameter. All individual settings can be specified beforehand in config.tjs

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

image.sample:
;Use a transition to switch the background image.
@layopt layer=message0 visible=false
[backlay]
[image layer=base page=back storage=rouka.jpg]
[trans time=2000]
[wt]
@layopt layer=message0 visible=true

iscript.name: iscript

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

jump.name: jump
jump.description:
Goes to the specified label in the specified file.
It is a mistake to use call if there is no jump on the call stack.
In other words, it can only be used one way. Setting a label is required.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: scenario file to move to. If this is left out the current scenario file will be used

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: label name to jump to. If this is left out it will go to the beginning.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

jump.sample:
; Go to the scenario file second.ks in the place with the label: *start
[jump storage=second.ks target=*start]

kanim.name: kanim
kanim.description: This executes a keyframe animation. You can implement a complex animation by defining the name as well as the text and pictures you want to animate with the [keyframe] tag.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: sets the name of the text or image that will be animated

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: if you don’t set the name and set the layer instead this will animate all elements in the layer

parameters.name: keyframe
parameters.description: sets the name of the keyframe animation

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: the time of the animation in milliseconds

parameters.name: easing
parameters.description: set the pattern of change for the animation.Some of the things you can set are:ease(smoothly at the beginning and end)linear(plays at a set interval)ease- in(plays back slowly at the beginning)ease-out(plays back slowly at the end)ease-in-out(plays back slowly at the beginning and end)it’s possible to set the easing your own way by using the cubic-bezier function

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: milliseconds before playback. default is 0

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: animations can alternate between their reverse and normal progression. default is “normal” and “alternate” sets the animation to alternate between normal and reverse

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: set the status before and after playback. Default is “forwards” and it maintains the same configuration after play. If set to “none” it will not maintain the same configuration.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

keyframe.name: keyframe
keyframe.description: Set animation keyframe. The defined animation can be used by setting the [kanim] tag.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Sets the names of the key frame. This will be the name to use if you use the kanim tag later.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

keyframe.sample:
;----setting the keyframe
[keyframe name="fuwafuwa"]
[frame p=40% x="100" ]
[frame p=100% y="-200" opacity=0 ]
[endkeyframe]
;-----run the defined animation

l.name: l
l.description:
This tag allows waiting for a click.

Sample Code

show some text...[l]
show some more text...[l][r]

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

layermode.name: layermode
layermode.description: This tag is used to blend images. It is recommended for use in PC games and may not be compatible with certain browsers.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Apply a name to a blend of layers. Use this name to undo a specific blend using [free_layermode].

parameters.name: graphic
parameters.description: Select a file to be blended. The file should be placed in the /image folder.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Set a color to blend in the format 0xFFFFFF.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Select a blend method. The default is ‘multiply’; other available methods are: screen, overlay, darken, lighten, color-dodge, color-burn, hard-light, soft-light, difference, exclusion, hue, saturation, color, luminosity

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Change the image folder referred by the graphic parameter. E.g. /bgimage will use the folder for background images.

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: Set an opacity value from 0 to 255. 0 is completely opaque. The default value is 255.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The duration over which blending will be carried out in milliseconds.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Set whether or not to wait for the blend to complete. Use the parameters ‘true’ or ‘false’. The default value is ‘true’.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

layermode_movie.name: layermode_movie
layermode_movie.description:
Use this to blend a movie with the game screen.
Please note: This function is recommended for use in PC games and may not be compatible with certain browsers.
Use the [free_layermode] tag to remove the effect.
Movie file formats that can be used are: ogv, webm, and mp4, although compatibility may differ depending upon the game.
For PC, please use webm. mp4 cannot be used.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Assign a name to the blended layers. This name can be used to undo a specific blend using [free_layermode].

parameters.name: video
parameters.description: Set a movie file to blend. Place the file in the /video folder.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: Set the volume of the movie to be blended, using a value from 0 to 100. The default is 0 (silent).

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: Set whether the movie should loop using ‘true’ or ‘false’. The default is ‘true’. If looping is enabled, the movie will loop until a [free_layermode] t tag is met.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Set the playback speed of the movie. The default is 1; 2 plays at x2 speed, 0.5 at x0.5 speed.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Select a blend method. The available methods are multiply (default), screen, overlay, darken, lighten, color-dodge, color-burn, hard-light, soft- light, difference, exclusion, hue, saturation, color, luminosity

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: Set an opacity value from 0 to 255. 0 is completely opaque. The default value is 255.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The duration over which blending will be carried out in milliseconds.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Set whether or not to wait for the blend to complete. Use the parameters ‘true’ or ‘false’. The default value is ‘true’.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

layopt.name: layopt

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: This sets the target layer or message layer. if you only set the message it will be set with the [current] tag and the current layer that you’re working with will become the message layer

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: sets as “fore” (default) or “back”. But if layer

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: sets whether or not the layer is visible. The visibility will not change if this attribute is omitted

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: sets the layer position from the left. If this omitted there is no position change. If you want to change the position of message0 or message1 use the [position] tag instead

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: sets the layer position from the top. If this omitted there is no position change. If you want to change the position of message0 or message1 use the [position] tag instead

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: sets the opacity of the layer from 0-255. 255 is totally transparent.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

link.name: link
link.description:
the text inside the [link] and [endlink] tags can be selected with the mouse or keyboard. on a click or key event a jump event can be fired.
This tag cannot be used to visit a different page.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: set the scenario file to jump to. if omitted the current scenario file

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: set the label to jump to. If omitted the script will be executed from the beginning of the file

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

link.sample:
pick what you like[l][r][r]
[link target=*select1] 1- first choice[endlink][r]
[link target=*select2] 2- second choice[endlink][r]
[s]
*select1
[cm]
you clicked the first choice
@jump target=*common
*select2
[cm]
you clicked the second choice
@jump target=*common
*common
[cm]
Common Route

Set placement of graphical buttons.
There is no support for writing text.

macro.name: macro
macro.description:
Start macro definition.
The statements between this tag and the [endmacro]tag will register a new tag named after the name attribute. Then you can use this new tag.
When an inner tag’s attribute value is prefixed with the % symbol, that parameter is passed through when defined by the macro. If a | is used in conjunction with the %, a default parameter can be defined.
Also, all parameters are passed through when the “*” is used.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the new tag to register as a macro. Afterwards this name can be used as a normal tag.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

macro.sample:
[macro name="newtag"][font color=0xff0000]new tag[resetfont][endmacro]
[newtag]
[macro name="colortag"][font color=%iro]color tag[resetfont][endmacro]
[colortag iro=0x332211]
; ? iro is passed through colortag to the [font] tag within the macro by using a "%"
[macro name="transwait"][trans *][wt][endmacro]
; ? transwait all of the properties passed to the [transwait] tag are passed to the [trans]
tag with a "*"
[macro name="colortag"][font color=%iro|0xff0000]the iro property is supplied if not
set[resetfont][endmacro]
; ? in conjunction with the "%" syntax the "|" is used to supply default parameters

mask.name: mask
mask.summary: Apply a Mask Layer to the Game Screen
mask.description:
This can be used to apply rich effects to game screen and also hide the screen.
One application would be to hide the game screen while changes are made, then show the updated screen with [mask_off].

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Set the duration over which the mask will be applied.

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: The following effects may be applied to masks: fadeIn (default), fadeIn, fadeInDownBig, fadeInLeftBig, fadeInRightBig, fadeInUpBig, flipInX, flipInY, lightSpeedIn, rotateIn, rotateInDownLeft, rotateInDownRight, rotateInUpLeft, rotateInUpRight, zoomIn, zoomInDown, zoomInLeft, zoomInRight, zoomInUp, slideInDown, slideInLeft, slideInRight, slideInUp, bounceIn , bounceInDown, bounceInLeft, bounceInRight, bounceInUp, rollIn

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Set a font color in the format 0xFFFFFF. The default is black.

parameters.name: graphic
parameters.description: Set a custom image to use to hide the screen. Place the image in the /image folder.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Set a folder other than /the image folder to contain the graphic. E.g. /bgimage or /fgimage.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

mask.sample:
; Apply the mask
[mask effect="fadeInDownBig" time=2000]

; Change the image while the screen is obscured
[bg storage="umi.jpg" time=500]

; Remove the mask
[mask_off]

mask_off.name: mask_off
mask_off.description: Remove a screen mask and resume the game.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Set the duration over which the mask will be removed.

parameters.name: effect
parameters.description: The following effects may be applied when removing masks: ‘fadeOut’ (default), f fadeOut, fadeOutDownBig, fadeOutLeftBig, fadeOutRightBig, fadeOutUpBig, flipOutX, flipOutY, lightSpeedOut, rotateOut, rotateOutDownLeft, rotateOutDownRight, rotateOutUpLeft, rotateOutUpRight, zoomOut, zoomOutDown, zoomOutLeft, zoomOutRight, zoomOutUp, slideOutDown, slideOutLeft, slideOutRight, slideOutUp, bounceOut , bounceOutDown, bounceOutLeft, bounceOutRight, bounceOutUp

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

mask_off.sample:
; Apply the mask
[mask effect="fadeInDownBig" time=2000]

; Change the image while the screen is obscured
[bg storage="umi.jpg" time=500]

; Remove the mask
[mask_off]

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: the file where an mp4 is stored

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: set whether or not this is skippable.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

mtext.name: mtext
mtext.description:
Displays text on the screen with various animation effects. Visit http://tyrano.jp/mtext/ to test the types of animation available.
[layeropt layer=0 visible=true] is required.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: Specifies the target layer. Set “base” for the background layer, and any positive number for the foreground layer.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies the target page. Please set this to “fore” or “back”. If this parameter is missing it will default to “fore”.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Specifies the text to be displayed.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Sets the left edge location of the text. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Sets the top edge location of the text. (In pixels.)

parameters.name: vertical
parameters.description: Please set to true or false. True will display the text vertically. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Sets the font size in pixels.

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: Sets the font type. This is not KAG compatible, but you can use web fonts.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Sets the font color.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Tyranoscript Only. You can use the anim tag to create an animation using this name. By specifying a name, you can also control it from JavaScript as a class attribute. It’s possible to specify multiple names by separating them with a comma.

parameters.name: bold
parameters.description: Sets whether to use bold text or not. If it’s HTML-5 compatible you can change it to specify the font-style.

parameters.name: fadeout
parameters.description: Set to true or false to determine whether or not to fade out the text after it’s displayed. The default is true. To delete the remaining characters use the freeimage tag to delete the layer.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Sets the time the text remains still in milliseconds.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Set to true or false. If set to true, processing will wait until the text effect is finished. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: in_effect
parameters.description: Sets the animation to used when the text is displayed.

parameters.name: in_delay
parameters.description: Sets the speed at which the text is displayed. Specifies the time for each character to appear in milliseconds. Default is 50 milliseconds.

parameters.name: in_delay_scale
parameters.description: Sets the ratio of the animation for each character. Default is 1.5.

parameters.name: in_sync
parameters.description: If this is set to true, all characters will begin their animation at the same time. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: in_shuffle
parameters.description: If set to true, the timing of each character animation will be randomized. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: in_reverse
parameters.description: If set to true, the characters will appear in reverse order. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: out_effect
parameters.description: Sets the animation to used when the text disappears.

parameters.name: out_delay
parameters.description: Sets the speed at which the text disappears. Specifies the time for each character to disappear in milliseconds. Default is 50 milliseconds.

parameters.name: out_sync
parameters.description: If this is set to true, all characters will begin their animation at the same time. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: out_shuffle
parameters.description: If set to true, the timing of each character animation will be randomized. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: out_reverse
parameters.description: If set to true, the characters will disappear in reverse order. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

mtext.sample:
;Since it defaults to displaying in the foreground layer, we'll make it visible.
[layopt layer=0 visible=true]
[mtext text="Text to Display" x=100 y=100 in_effect="fadeIn" out_effect="fadeOut"]

nolog.name: nolog
nolog.description:
Writing to backlog will stop when this tag is met.
Writing to backlog will be enabled again when the [endnolog] tag is met.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

nolog.sample:
Backlog writing is enabled.[p]
[nolog]
Backlog writing is disenabled.[p]
Backlog writing is still disenabled.[p]
[endnolog]
Backlog re-enabled from here.[p]

nowait.name: nowait

parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

p.description:

Show text[p] Show text[p][r]

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

playbgm.name: playbgm
playbgm.description:
Play BGM in HTML5 standard audio format (ogg, mp3, mp4, webm).
Playback files should be stored in the project’s bgm folder.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Set the file to be used

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: set as true (default) or false. true will repeat the loop

parameters.name: click
parameters.description: Set to true or false (default) when used for smart phone browsers. If set to true a click is needed before playback will start in smart phone browsers.With smart phones without a click no sound is assigned to play. For example after a scene change when you want music playback if you do not set this to true no music will play. In the middle of most text false is ok for playback. Check if music is playing on smartphones and set this to true if necessary.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: number of milliseconds for the playback to start

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

playse.name: playse
playse.description:
Play a sound effect
Sound effect files are stored in the project’s \sound folder

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Set the playback file

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: set true or false (default). true will repeat the sound when it is done

parameters.name: clear
parameters.description: true or false (default). When another sound effect is playing interrupt it and start playing this. true could be useful for voice

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

plugin.name: plugin
plugin.description:
Use this to load third party plugins.
Plugins should be placed in the folder /data/others/plugin/
The plugin tag can also freely pass parameters. For example:
[plugin name=”original1″ font_color=”black” myname=”Johnny Appleseed” ]
In the above example, parameters such as mp.font_color and mp.myname may be available in init.ks which uses the plugin.
This allows the creation of customizable plugins.
Please note: macros functions such as %font_color cannot be used.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Select a folder (plugin) name from within /data/others/plugin.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Use this to change the scenario file that will be read first. The default is init.ks .

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

plugin.sample:
; Change the theme
[plugin name="original1" ]

; Parameters can be freely passed
[plugin name="original1" font_color="black" arg2="aaaaaa" ]

position.name: position
position.description:
Set various options for the message layer.
Any parameters that are omitted will not change their attributes.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: set target message layer. If this is omitted the current layer will be used.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: set target page. set”fore” or “back”. If this is omitted the current page will be used

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: message layer’s position from the left in pixels

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: message layer’s position from the top in pixels

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: message layer’s width in pixels

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: message layer’s height in pixels

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: set image for the message layer’s frame image. use this to customize the message area. adjust image size is according to the width and height attributes. futhermore you should use this to regulate the places where the message will be displayed by margin attributes. if you set this to “none” it will return to the standard margin. You can also change it to designate a different frame image.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: sets the color of the message layer with a 0xRRGGBB format

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: this sets the opacity for the message layer. This does not affect the opacity of the text itself or the layer.0 is completely transparent.

parameters.name: marginl
parameters.description: message layer’s left margin

parameters.name: margint
parameters.description: message layer’s top margin

parameters.name: marginr
parameters.description: message layer’s left margin

parameters.name: marginb
parameters.description: message layer’s bottom margin

parameters.name: vertical
parameters.description: set message layer’s vertical mode with “true”. Use “false” for horizontal mode.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: if set to “true” message layer is visible false hides the message layer.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

position.sample:
;message layer position and size
[position width=400 height=300 top=100 left=20]
;message layer color and opacity
[position color=blue opacity=100]

preload.name: preload
preload.description:
Using the preload tag, you can load files (images or music) before they are needed
The presentation will be smooth when they are needed.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: enter the full path for previously entered images. They are set in the order that they are passed in.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: this can be set to true or false. The default is false. When this is set to true all the game is paused until the images are loaded. You will need a loading screen.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

preload.sample:
;Use the full path below the project directory
[preload storage="data/fgimage/girl.jpg"]
;You can also specify an array
[iscript]
f.preload_images = ["data/fgimage/girl.jpg","data/fgimage/haruko.png","data/fgimage/miku1.png","data/fgimage/miku2.png"]; [endscript]

[preload storage=&f.preload_images]

ptext.name: ptext
ptext.description:
This displays text in the layer. Only performed in the foreground layer.
This will inherit all of the attributes of the foreground layer. when text is deleted, it applies to the [freeimage] tag in the layer.
Keep in mind that if the foreground layer is not set to visible=true this text will also not display.
[layopt layer=0 visible=true] is required

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: this sets the target layer. you can reference it by number.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: sets the target page. can be set as set as “fore” or “back”. defaults to “fore”

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: horizontal position from left border in pixels

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: vertical position from top border in pixels

parameters.name: vertical
parameters.description: set to true or false (this is the default). If set to true the text reads vertically. If false the text is horizontal.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: set the font size in pixels

parameters.name: face
parameters.description: set the font type. This is not KAG compatible but you can use web fonts

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: set the font color

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: TyranoScript only (not KAG3). This name is used later to reference this by tags like [anim] tag. Basically by setting this name you can set this as a JS class. If you divide them with commas you can designate multiple names.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

ptext.sample:
[backlay]
[ptext page=back text="texttext" size=30 x=200 y=300 color=red vertical=true]
[trans time=2000]
[wt]
[l]
Clear the displayed text
[freeimage layer = 0]

pushlog.name: pushlog
pushlog.description:
Can be used to freely insert characters or text into the backlog.
For example, text such as [mtext] is not usually written to the backlog,
but by utilizing this tag in macros, etc. additional text can be inserted to the backlog.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Add this text to the backlog.

parameters.name: join
parameters.description: Specify whether to prefix the text to the backlog or not. When set to ‘true’, the text will precede the backlog. The default is ‘false’.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

pushlog.sample: [pushlog text="This text has been inserted into the backlog."]

qr_config.name: qr_config
qr_config.description: Use this tag to set various parameters for QR code operations.

parameters.name: qrcode
parameters.description: Sets the operation to trigger when the QR code is read. “Jump” (for QR codes that trigger only in-game transitions), “web” (for links to other sites), “define” (for operations defined using qr_define), “all” (for all), “off” (does not respond to QR codes). The default is “off”.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

qr_config.sample:
; Enable only in-project jumps for QR codes
[qr_config qrcode = "jump"]

qr_define.name: qr_define
qr_define.description:
Replaces a QR code URL with an in-project jump.
E.g. Use to replace the QR code on an object or product with an in-game event.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Sets the URL that will trigger a reaction when detected by the camera.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Sets the jump destination scenario file to be activated when the URL is read.

parameters.name: target

parameters.name: clear
parameters.description: Sets to true to clear the setting. Default is false.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

quake.name: quake
quake.description:
For a set number of milliseconds?the screen will shake. (KAG3 does not support setting the number of characters)
if you set the vmax attribute to 0 it will only shake horizontally. if you set the hmax attribute to 0 it will only shake vertically.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Set the number of times to shake the screen

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Set as true or false. if set to true the game will pause during the shaking. true is the default

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Set the number of milliseconds to shake the screen per count. default is 300ms

parameters.name: hmax
parameters.description: The maximum number of pixels to shake the screen horizontally. The default is 10(px).

parameters.name: vmax
parameters.description: The maximum number of pixels to shake the screen vertically. The default is 10(px).

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

reset_camera.name: reset_camera
reset_camera.description:
Sets the camera back to the default position.
After you’ve finished using the [camera] tag, please be sure to use the [reset_camera] tag to return it to the original position. If you do not, you will not be able to change backgrounds or use other functionality.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Sets the time in milliseconds for the camera to return to its original position. Default is 1,000.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Sets whether to wait for the camera to finish moving. If this is set to false, the game can continue during the camera movement. Defaults to true.

When you want to apply ruby characters to a multi-character string, you need to set ruby characters for every character in the string.

parameters.name: cond

choices shown in [link] tags etc. will have no way to execute them.

sleepgame.name: sleepgame
sleepgame.description:
When this tag is reached, the game state is saved, and then processing is moved to another scenario file. When the [awakegame] tag is executed in the other scenario file, you can return to the original game.
This tag is extremely powerful when you want to temporarily move to a different screen. For example, when you want to adjust configuration options during play, you can use the [sleepgame] tag to save the play state and then move to the configuration screen. Use the [awakegame] tag to return to the original game.
It is not possible to execute multiple [sleepgame] commands. Make sure to use the [awakegame] command. If you do not, the [breakgame] tag will be used to discard the saved play state.
When using a [ button ] to call this tag, you can set the role to sleepgame so that the sleepgame command will be executed when the button is pressed.

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Specifies the name of the scenario to start when the current one is temporarily paused. If this is missing it will use the current file name.

parameters.name: Target
parameters.description: Specifies the label name to jump to. If this is missing, processing will begin with the first line of the file.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

sleepgame.sample:
[gamesleep storage="scene3.ks" target="*start" ]

;To associate this function with a button.
[button name="button" role="sleepgame" fix="true" graphic="button/skip.gif" x=450 y=400
storage="scene3.ks" ]

trans.name: trans
trans.description:
transition to the set layer.
transition is a way to move the back layer to the front.
after transition, the surface page’s status of the target layer image’s placement, size, visibility, invisibility are made to be the same as the back page.
Also, during a transition do not change the properties of the layers

parameters.name: set the target layer
parameters.description: if a number greater than 0 is used it will become a foreground layer if you set as message0 or message1 then it will become that message layer. layer No if you set is as message it will become the message layer of whatever the [current] tag is set to Even if the message layer is the back page it will copy that message layer from the front to the back. if this is omitted the information of every layer is copied to the back pageNormally the background changes are used.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: set the transition type. The default is “crossfade”. Other possibilities are?crossfade?? explode??slide??blind??bounce??clip??drop??fold??puff? ?scale??shake??size?

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: the time for the transition is set in milliseconds

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

voconfig.name: voconfig
voconfig.description:
Use this to add voiceover to your games.
VO audio files can be played when the character name is displayed by connecting character names and with VO filenames.
After setting this tag, the [vostart] tag must be used to begin playback.

parameters.name: sebuf
parameters.description: Use this to set the playse buf used by the VO.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Set the name of the character that will use the VO. This is the name set in the chara_new ] tag.

parameters.name: vostorage
parameters.description: Set the template of the filename that will be used as the voice file. [number] below is the number of times that VO has been played plus 1.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The default is 0. The number stored in vostorage can be reset by specifying a value here.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

voconfig.sample:
[voconfig sebuf=2 name="akane" vostorage="akane_{number}.ogg" number=1 ]
[voconfig sebuf=2 name="yamato" vostorage="yamato_{number}.ogg" number=1 ]

; Begin automatic playback. This is a must-have step
[vostart]

#akane
Play the VO clip here (akane_1.ogg)[p]

#akane
The next VO clip (akane_2.ogg)[p]

#yamato
Play Yamato's VO (yamato_1.ogg)[p]

#akane
Play Akane's VO (akane_3.ogg)[p]

wbgm.name: wbgm
wbgm.description: Waits for the background music to finish playing. Note that if the playbgm tag is causing the music to loop, the game will get stuck. This tag can be used for PC and browser games, but will not work for smartphone apps.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

web.name: web
web.description:
Open a specified website in the browser.
Note: an ‘await click’ must be placed immediately this tag.
Many environments restrict browsers from opening without user initiation.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Sets the URL of the webpage to be opened.

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.

xchgbgm.name: xchgbgm
xchgbgm.description:
Crossfade BGM
Mix one music in as another fades out.
PLEASE NOTE: This is not compatible with Firefox and Safari browsers. In these cases, they will fall back to playbgm

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: set the next file for playback

parameters.name: loop
parameters.description: set true (default) or false. true will repeat the sound when it is done

parameters.name: click
parameters.description: Set to true or false (default) when used for smart phone browsers. If set to true a click is needed before playback will start in smart phone browsers.With smart phones without a click no sound is assigned to play. For example after a scene change when you want music playback if you do not set this to true no music will play. In the middle of most text false is ok for playback. Check if music is playing on smartphones and set this to true if necessary.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: number of milliseconds for the cross fade to occur

parameters.name: cond
parameters.description: You can input a JavaScript formula, and the tag will only be executed if the result is true.
